articles.headline: Google’s Legal Peril Grows in Face of Third Antitrust Suit
articles.snippet: More than 30 states said that the company downplayed websites that let users search for information in specialized areas.
articles.abstract: More than 30 states said that the company downplayed websites that let users search for information in specialized areas.
articles.lead_paragraph: More than 30 states added to Google’s mushrooming legal woes on Thursday, accusing the Silicon Valley titan of illegally arranging its search results to push out smaller rivals.
articles.byline: By David McCabe, Cecilia Kang and Daisuke Wakabayashi

articles.headline: More Hacking Attacks Found as Officials Warn of ‘Grave Risk’ to U.S. Government
articles.snippet: Minutes after the government statement, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. warned that his administration would impose “substantial costs” on those responsible. President Trump has been silent on the hacking.
articles.abstract: Minutes after the government statement, President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. warned that his administration would impose “substantial costs” on those responsible. President Trump has been silent on the hacking.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal officials issued an urgent warning on Thursday that hackers who American intelligence agencies believed were working for the Kremlin used a far wider variety of tools than previously known to penetrate government systems, and said that the cyberoffensive was “a grave risk to the federal government.”
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and Nicole Perlroth

articles.headline: How May We Serve You? For Restaurant Chains, It Depends on the Location
articles.snippet: Large dine-in chains are finding it difficult to enact uniform approaches to the pandemic when dealing with different regulations across the country about how they can operate.
articles.abstract: Large dine-in chains are finding it difficult to enact uniform approaches to the pandemic when dealing with different regulations across the country about how they can operate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Executives at the Brazilian steakhouse chain Fogo de Chão thought they had seen the worst of it.
articles.byline: By Julie Creswell and Gillian Friedman

articles.headline: Carrier Plant Is Bustling, but Workers Are Wary as Trump Exits
articles.snippet: The president championed an Indiana factory facing a shutdown four years ago. Hundreds of jobs were kept, and overtime abounds. Can the revival last?
articles.abstract: The president championed an Indiana factory facing a shutdown four years ago. Hundreds of jobs were kept, and overtime abounds. Can the revival last?
articles.lead_paragraph: For the workers fortunate enough to remain employed at Carrier’s Indianapolis factory, which Donald Trump singled out as a symbol of American manufacturing distress in 2016, these should be the best of times. The assembly line is churning out furnaces seven days a week, overtime is abundant, and shares of Carrier are soaring even as Covid-19 ravages the overall economy.

articles.headline: A Riveting ISIS Story, Told in a Times Podcast, Falls Apart
articles.snippet: A Canadian’s gruesome account as an Islamic State executioner in Syria, which was the subject of the “Caliphate” podcast by The New York Times, was fabricated, officials say. A Times review found no corroboration of his claim to have committed atr...
articles.abstract: A Canadian’s gruesome account as an Islamic State executioner in Syria, which was the subject of the “Caliphate” podcast by The New York Times, was fabricated, officials say. A Times review found no corroboration of his claim to have committed atrocities.
articles.lead_paragraph: He described the killings in lurid detail — how he shot one man in the head and stabbed another in the heart before hanging the corpse on a cross.
articles.byline: By Mark Mazzetti, Ian Austen, Graham Bowley and Malachy Browne

articles.headline: Is There Such a Thing as a Humane Eviction?
articles.snippet: As a bulge of evictions looms, a Massachusetts sheriff is searching for ways to soften the blow.
articles.abstract: As a bulge of evictions looms, a Massachusetts sheriff is searching for ways to soften the blow.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICOPEE, Mass. — The tenants in the third-floor apartment had 30 minutes to leave.
